definition: to keep goal/on duty as gatekeeper
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
goalkeeper
gatekeeper

sentences.english: I'll try my best to rout out a good goalkeeper for our football team.
sentences.chinese: 我願盡力爲我們的足球隊物色一位優秀的守門員。

sentences.english: The goalkeeper just managed to palm the ball over the crossbar.
sentences.chinese: 守門員用手掌勉強把球擋過球門橫木。

sentences.english: Only the two back-up goalkeepers and central defender Raul Albiol did not get playing time.
sentences.chinese: 只有2個替補守門員和中衛阿爾比奧爾沒上場。
守門員竟完全沒機會擋球。

sentences.english: He replaced his brother as goalkeeper.
sentences.chinese: 他代替他哥哥當守門員。

sentences.english: The team's efforts to score were frustrated by the opposing goalkeeper.
sentences.chinese: 該隊想要進球的努力被對方的守門員挫敗了。

sentences.english: If you get the ball, throw it straight to the wicket-keeper.
sentences.chinese: 如果你得到球，直接扔給守門員。
我們少一個好的守門員。

sentences.english: I have been elected best goalkeeper by the South America Foot-ball Federation in succession three years in a row.
sentences.chinese: 我連續三年被南美足球聯合會推舉爲最佳守門員。

sentences.english: In the end, I've gone for JERZY DUDEK as the goalkeeper.
sentences.chinese: 最後，我會選杜德克作爲守門員。

sentences.english: And I have seen the eternal Footman hold my coat, and snicker.
sentences.chinese: 我曾眼見永恆的守門人接過我的大衣，然後竊笑。

sentences.english: Now they have to be reading the game and the goalkeeper is now the sweeper.
sentences.chinese: 現在他們必須閱讀比賽，守門員現在就是清道夫。

sentences.english: The priests who guarded the entrance put into the chest all the money that was brought to the temple of the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 守門的祭司將奉到耶和華殿的一切銀子投在櫃裏。

sentences.english: Do NOT be afraid to make a pass back to your defenders or GK if options in front are limited.
sentences.chinese: 前方沒有機會時，不要忌諱回傳給後衛或守門員。

to tease/to poke fun at
red in the face/extremely angry

to toll a bell
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
evil spirit/devil
